Plot: In modern-day Paris, a journalist finds her life becoming entwined with a young girl whose family was torn apart during the notorious Vel' d'Hiv Roundup in 1942.
Title: Sarah's Key
Writer: Tatiana De Rosnay (novel), Serge Joncour (screenplay), Gilles Paquet-Brenner (screenplay)
Actors: Kristin Scott Thomas, Mélusine Mayance, Niels Arestrup, Frédéric Pierrot
tomatoConsensus: Sarah's Key is an absorbing, impeccably-acted Holocaust drama with minor plot issues.
